title: Attention and Its Limits
content: Attention is a limited resource. Humans can focus on approximately one demanding task at a time. Multitasking is actually rapid task-switching, and each switch has a cost. When demands exceed capacity, performance degrades—often without awareness that degradation is occurring.

mcq.question: You're monitoring two complex systems simultaneously. Both require attention at the same moment. What happens?

options.B: One system gets attention while the other is neglected

mcq.explanation: Attention doesn't divide—it switches. One system gets focus while the other goes unmonitored. This happens even when we believe we're monitoring both. Design should prevent simultaneous demands on single operators.

openQuestions: When has limited attention caused problems in your work?
How does your operation manage competing demands for attention?
